channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: 9th Circuit rules that National Guard can deploy to Portland
item.description: The appeals court overturned the ruling of a lower court judge in Oregon, and clears the way for President Trump to deploy the National Guard to Portl...

item.title: Cannabis blunts back pain in 2 new studies
item.description: Millions of Americans use weed to treat chronic pain, but there's little high quality research on whether it works. New findings suggest it can be eff...

item.title: Gaza ceasefire deal violated. And, shutdown enters day 20 with no end in sight
item.description: Israel and Hamas say they are committed to the ceasefire after clashes over the weekend. And, lawmakers not feeling the pressures of the government sh...

item.title: Trump's fake video featured 'Danger Zone.' Musician Kenny Loggins wants it scrubbed
item.description: The "Danger Zone" singer is asking for his performance to be deleted from a fake "King Trump" video that the president posted to Truth Social on Satur...

item.title: This isn't the Louvre's first high-profile heist. Here's a history of earlier thefts
item.description: Masked thieves stole priceless jewels from the Louvre on Sunday morning. The Paris museum has suffered a string of successful art heists, dating back ...

item.title: Senate holds 11th vote to fund government on Day 20 of shutdown
item.description: The government shutdown extends into Day 20 on Monday as the Senate plans its eleventh vote on a House-passed measure to end the impasse. Follow live ...

item.title: Appellate judges question moves to keep Alina Habba in place as top New Jersey prosecutor
Former NFL player Doug Martin dies in police custody in California
item.description: His former team, the Tampa Bay Buccaneers, said they were "deeply saddened" by the ex-player's death.

item.title: Catholic clergy sex abuse victims hopeful after Pope Leo meeting
item.description: The Pope acknowledged "resistance in some parts of the world" to permanently remove a priest who abuses a child, the group said.

item.title: US strikes on Latin American 'drug boats': What do we know, and are they legal?
item.description: Experts have suggested several attacks launched by the US may be illegal under international law.

item.title: These confederate statues caused US protests. Knocked down, they're the centre of a new art show
item.description: The 18 decommissioned Confederate monuments have been deconstructed and displayed to make a statement on the horrors of slavery.

item.title: Mexican cartel boss "El Gato" faces new charge in 2013 Texas murder
item.description: Former FBI Top 10 fugitive Jose Rodolfo "El Gato" Villareal-Hernandez faces new federal charges tied to a 2013 Southlake murder that could carry the d...

item.title: 9/15: The Takeout with Major Garrett
item.description: Suspect in Charlie Kirk shooting is not cooperating, Utah governor says; Oklahoma City’s GOP mayor makes the case for diversity.

item.title: Cannabis drinks are booming even as Americans consume less alcohol
item.description: Consumer demand for cannabis-infused beverages is growing even as Americans drink less booze, with major brands testing the waters.

item.title: Man who appeared to fake death to avoid rape charges sentenced to 5 years
item.description: Jurors found Nicholas Rossi​, 38, guilty of rape after a three-day trial in which his accuser and her parents each took the stand.

item.title: Palestinian woman in hospital after being clubbed by masked Israeli settler
item.description: The attacker is seen striking the 55-year-old woman with a large wooden stick during the assault in the West Bank village of Turmus Ayaa.

item.title: California police say shrapnel hits and damages a patrol vehicle during Marine Corps drills
George Santos says he’s humbled but dismisses ‘pearl clutching’ critics
